intro: Lepechinia floribunda, commonly known as the showy lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or meadows. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lepechinia floribunda is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
